wikipedia_page.main: Henrietta "Harriet" Sheppard, née Campbell (1786-1858) was a Canadian naturalist and botanist.  She was noted for studying and publishing on birds, shells, and plants of the Quebec region.  Working with Anne Mary Perceval and Lady Dalhousie she collected plants of the region.The standard author abbreviation Sheppard is used to indicate this person as the author when citing a botanical name.
